comment.author: 7787431@N07
comment._content: The gent in the light colored trousers and bow tie in the front row is my Grandfather Ned "Neddo"Barry who lived directly across from here.

comment.author: 47290943@N03

comment.author: 7787431@N07
comment._content: Hi Jasonw1996 and National Library,the house(the one on the left) you have shown on Google maps is my Grandfathers family home,the decorated house in the photo is directly opposite.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/7787431@N07] Thanks! So this is the correct house from our photo, opposite your grandfather's?

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: Noonies12 was your grandfather Neddo Barry the same man who had the guide dog later in life?

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: I remember him alright, he had a black labrador I think for a long time. Do you mind me asking what happened to his eyesight? My own grandfather went blind due to glaucoma in his later years.

comment.author: 7787431@N07
comment._content: yes he had a black lab called Wag which was the first Guide dog in the south east,I think my grandfather had to go to Exeter in the UK to get the dog from the guide dogs for the blind assoc .After Wag he had Muffin a golden Labrador guide dog. Neddo had a fall in school when he was young which damaged his nose/eye socket ,this injury was not treated properly and this led to a gradual deterioration of his sight.BTW Paddy Browns Road says hello,next time you speak to him ask him about me.
